name: Lily Bowen
descriptions: Lillian Marie Bowen, typically truncated to Lily, is a nightkin and former assassin of the Unity, now residing in Jacobstown, where she shepherds the town's bighorner cattle, in the Mojave Wasteland in Fallout: New Vegas. She is a possible companion of the Courier.
Eventually, after the fall of Unity, the destruction of the Cathedral and the death of the Master, whom she didn't like,

While looking for the remains of her old Vault, she made it as far as the Mojave Wasteland where she relocated to the settlement of Jacobstown, led and watched over by another first-gen super mutant, Marcus. Lily found purpose at Jacobstown as the shepherd of the town's bighorner cattle population.
While living at Jacobstown, she began receiving help from Doctor Henry for her schizophrenia, trying to drown out the voice of "Leo" by taking anti-psychotic drugs.

Due to not getting the full dose of anti-psychotics, "Leo" continued to manifest in Lily's mind as a malicious deviant and sociopathic voice she can communicate with, giving her instructions in battle and telling her to do "terrible things."

Despite her hulking appearance as a super-mutant, at her core Lily Bowen is a doting (and somewhat overprotective) grandmother. Her mental instability from long-term exposure to stealth boys has her view most of the wasteland through this lens, such as mistakenly viewing the Courier as one of her grandchildren, and wishing to travel with them to help protect them. However, as opposed to other addled minds in the wastes, she does understand the post-apocalyptic world she inhabits and its history. In particular she recalls her time serving under the Master as a time of discipline in her life.

Lily however suffers from a split personality- with another personality by the name of Uncle Leo encouraging her to act more violently. While under most circumstances she can ignore Uncle Leo's voice, sometimes this personality takes over when she blacks out, fighting much more ferociously and aggressively.

She struggles with her medication regimen, something she feels conflicted over, as she highly values the memories of her grandchildren, and her medication results in memory loss. Depending on player choices, the dosage she chooses to take can wildly effect her personality in the games endings.
"Look at that - a friendly Nightkin. What's it doing here?"

Additionally, Lily has a third companion weapon, a power fist variant called Lily's gauntlet. This weapon is not initially in Lily's inventory but may be given to her as part of a script that ensures all companions retain their special weapons.

Like all super mutants in New Vegas, Lily is limited in the weapons she can use, and can only equip weapons from the following list. Lily's default assault carbine's high DPS affects which weapons she will equip. There are only two holdout weapons which Lily is capable of using: frag grenades and plasma grenades.
Lily Bowen appears in Fallout: New Vegas and Fallout: Wasteland Warfare.
Lily Bowen was written by Travis Stout.
role: Vault dweller (formerly)Assassin/Spy (formerly)FarmerCompanionTest subject (duringGuess Who I Saw Today)

topics.response_text: No need to get bossy, dear.{Gramma}Grandma can hear you.

topics.topic_text: It's time for us to part ways.
topics.response_text: Aww,{gramma}grandma will miss her little pumpkin! Are you sure?

topics.topic_text: On second thought, stick with me for a little longer.
topics.response_text: Oh, pumpkin, you make{gramma}grandma so happy!

topics.topic_text: I'll miss you too, Lily, but it's time.
topics.response_text: All right, then, dearie. Now you promise to come visit{gramma}grandma soon, you hear?

topics.topic_text: I'd like you to go back to the Lucky 38 for now.
topics.response_text: Nice children shouldn't stay in places like that, dearie! That's the sort of place Leo likes! But if you insist....

topics.topic_text: I think we should travel together.
topics.response_text: That'd be lovely, dearie.
All right, dearie, let's go.
Didn't your mother ever tell you it's polite to help an old lady carry her bags?
Oh, don't you worry about me, dearie, your{gramma}grandma knows how to stay quiet.
Of course, dearie, I'll do whatever you want. I can't make any promises about Leo, though.

topics.topic_text: I want you to change your combat style.
topics.response_text: Ohhh, Leo might not like that, but I'll try, sweetheart.

topics.topic_text: I want you to attack enemies the moment you see them.
topics.response_text: You can keep repeating yourself all day, dearie, but I remember what you said.
Whatever you like, dearie.
Don't you want to give{gramma}grandma some sugar first?
Oh dearie me, I thought I already was! Have I been confused all this time?

topics.topic_text: I want you not to attack enemies unless I've already engaged them.
topics.response_text: Yes, dearie, that's what{gramma}grandma's been doing. And Leo isn't happy about it, either.

topics.topic_text: I want you to use ranged weapons.
topics.response_text: Well, if you insist, but Leo isn't going to like it much.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about how close you're following me.
topics.response_text: What's the matter, dearie? Afraid{gramma}grandma will embarass you in front of your little friends?
If I get any closer, I might squish you! And that would make{gramma}grandma sad.

topics.topic_text: Your distance is good. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: What can{gramma}grandma do for her little pumpkin?

topics.topic_text: All right, you're good. Let's get out of here.
topics.response_text: {Gramma}Grandma's right behind you, sugar!

topics.topic_text: Keep your distance. Try to flank them.
topics.response_text: Sweetie, I think{gramma}knows a little something about chopping evil people. That's what I've been doing.
{sing-songy}{Gramma}Grandma's got a present for you!
Don't go too far now, dearie!
That Keene, always causing trouble.
I wonder if Marcus knows about this place....
{Panicking}Ahh! Loud! Onetwothreefourfivesixseveneightninetenonetwothreefourfivesixseveneightnineten!
Nice puppies - do doggies want treats?
Ooh, look, pumpkin! A dinosaur! Do you want to ride the dinosaur?

topics.topic_text: What happened in that fight back there?
topics.response_text: Oh, pumpkin,{gramma}grandma's sorry about that. Sometimes she gets mad and listens to Leo when she really shouldn't.

topics.topic_text: I have some questions to ask you.
topics.response_text: Such a curious little munchkin, aren't you? What do you want to know?

topics.topic_text: What was that recording you were listening to?
topics.response_text: Oh, that old thing? That's a holotape from the last time I visited my grandkids. Such sweet little children, you know. Little angels.
Tabitha! You naughty, naughty girl! Leo remembers what you did!
My, aren't all these lights fancy?
Turning it on. Urgh... feels strange. Strange but good.
Grrr! Lily smash! Haha.
Awww... I liked having it on.

topics.topic_text: Lily, I'd like to talk to you about your medication.
topics.response_text: Oh, don't you worry your silly little head about that, pumpkin.{Gramma}Grandma knows what she's doing.
My, my, this reminds me of when I was a girl. Right over there would have been where your{grampa}grandpa and I had our first kiss!
{Player fired a gun near Lily}You'll put someone's eye out with that, dearie!
{Gently chiding, player's aiming a gun at her}Pumpkin, don't point that at{gramma}grandma, there's a dear.
{Very loud, just saw player lay a mine}Ohh, that's very sneaky, dear! I'll be sure not to tell anyone about that mine!
{Player just threw a grenade}Boom!
Lily's long life finally came to a close in the Mojave Wasteland. As the life faded from her, her last thoughts were of her grandchildren.
Bye.

topics.topic_text: What do you do in Jacobstown?
topics.response_text: I watch over the Bighorners. They're sweet, gentle creatures, but sometimes they get ornery. Just like my grandkids!

topics.topic_text: Did you still want to help Doctor Henry run his experiment?
topics.response_text: Of course, dearie. I know it's dangerous, but it'll all turn out for the best, you'll see. I'll go to him now - it would be rude to keep him waiting!

topics.topic_text: Doctor Henry wants to know if you'll continue to wear the Mark II prototype.
topics.response_text: Of course I will, dearie, if it's helpful. Don't you worry what will happen to little old me. I'm tougher than I look!

topics.topic_text: There's a risk that the mental damage will be permanent.
topics.response_text: Of course, dearie.
I know that, dearie.

topics.topic_text: All right, if you're sure. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Certainly!
Leo is a very bad man, pumpkin!{Aside}Yes you are, Leo, don't try to deny it!
Oh, Jimmy, don't you go being silly now! Come over here and give your{gramma}grandma some sugar!

topics.topic_text: I think you have me confused with someone else.
topics.response_text: I...{confused, realizing she's hallucinating}Oh, of course I have, dearie. How silly of me. I didn't take my medicine yet today. How can I help you?

topics.topic_text: Never mind. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Of course, Jimmy.
Aww, someone wants to hear{gramma's}grandma's stories! What would you like to hear, pumpkin?

topics.topic_text: What's the best way for me to use your skills?
topics.response_text: Isn't that sweet of you to fret about me? Such a good boy. I can always help you stay hidden from the bad people so you won't get in trouble.

topics.topic_text: Why don't you take your medicine?
topics.response_text: Sometimes it makes{gramma}grandma forget things she doesn't want to forget, pumpkin.

topics.topic_text: It's too dangerous for you to miss doses. From now on I want you to take your medicine every time.
topics.response_text: Are you sure, dearie? Taking my medicine all the time makes me feel woozy, but it does make it easier for me to ignore Leo.

topics.topic_text: Never mind, I had some other questions.
topics.response_text: What do you need, sugar?

topics.topic_text: You should keep taking your meds every other time. It's worth the risk to remember your family.
topics.response_text: That's sweet of you, dearie. I'll try to be better about controlling myself if I see you try to sneak away.
I grew up in Vault 17. I never even saw the sun until I was 75 years old - that was when Super mutants raided the Vault and carried a lot of us off.

topics.topic_text: That medicine isn't doing you any good. I want you to stop taking it altogether.
topics.response_text: Oh my stars! Are you sure? If I don't take any medicine at all, Leo gets especially cranky. I can't stop him when he's like that.

topics.topic_text: Never mind, we'll talk about it later.
topics.response_text: Whenever you're ready, dear.
{Correction}A spy. Sometimes an assassin. I killed a lot of folks for the Master.{Aside}Yes, Leo, you helped, too.
Oh, he was a nasty man, dearie. You don't want to know about him. He was the one who made that Super mutant army I told you about.
That wicked old Master got what was coming to him, that's what! After his cathedral blew up, I decided it was high time to go home.

topics.topic_text: What kind of medicine are you taking?
topics.response_text: Doctor Henry calls them{struggling to pronounce word}"anti-psychotics." I don't know what they're supposed to do, they just make my memory fuzzy.
This old thing? Oh, I scavenged it off a wreck in Klamath. Leo showed me how to make it all ready for chopping, didn't you, Leo?
Well of course there is, dearie. How else could I hear him tell me who to chop?

topics.topic_text: So he's just a voice you hear in your head?
topics.response_text: You shouldn't say things like that where Leo can hear you, dearie. He doesn't like it.

topics.topic_text: I'm sure. I'd rather you didn't have any psychotic breaks, even if it means you aren't as strong.
topics.response_text: Well, all right, then, dearie.{Sad}I suppose I'll have my holotapes to remind me of Becky and Jimmy....
Yes, dearie?
All right, pumpkin.

topics.topic_text: I'll risk you having more psychotic breaks if it means you're more dangerous in combat.
topics.response_text: All right, dear. If you're really sure.

topics.topic_text: Why is it hard to remember them?
topics.response_text: It's my medicine, dearie. It keeps me calm, but it makes my memory go all fuzzy. That's why I only take my dosage every other time.

topics.topic_text: Earlier, it seemed like you knew Tabitha. What's the story there?
topics.response_text: Tabitha was{gramma's}grandma's squad leader when we both worked for the Master. She wasn't very nice at all, but she was good at the chopping.

topics.topic_text: I'm looking into the Nightstalker mutation. Want to come along with me?
topics.response_text: Oooh, those Nightstalkers, always killing my Bighorners! It'll be nice to give them a piece of my mind!

conversation.response_text: Do little angels want butterscotch candies? Sweets for sweeties!
Ohh... that was a bad one, wasn't it, Leo?

combat.response_text: You shouldn't be so mean to people!
{Angry}You'll make Leo angry!
Leo is going to give you such a paddling, you won't be able to sit down for a week!
Be careful, sweetie!
{Critically injured}{Gramma's}Grandma's limbs aren't doing too well, pumpkin.
{Death Noise 1}
Wake up, sleepyhead!{Uncertain, doesn't realize the person is dead}Wake up? ...Please?
This is going to be loud, sweetie!
Get away from them, sweetie! Follow{gramma}grandma!
Go away! Go away!
Oh dear,{gramma}grandma's not feeling too good!
{Freaking out, going crazy scream}
You shouldn't be so naughty, pumpkin!
Sweetie, leave that messy business to Leo.
Sweetie,{gramma}grandma needs some more ammunition!
{Gramma}Grandma's feeling woozy - be a dear and fetch her a poison antidote?
{Getting second wind}Oh,{gramma}grandma feels much better now.
Sweetie, if you want something, just ask{gramma}grandma politely.
{Gramma}Grandma's feeling much better now.
Is{gramma}grandma's nap over already?
Leo broke another weapon! I told you you hit too hard, Leo!
This weapon isn't working! And Leo doesn't like that very much!
